column3: Other places do this, but it frustrates grepping the source code.
If you do so, maybe also tackle the LogPrintf's and get rid of static "CWalletXX::" there?

> it frustrates grepping the source code\n\nAt first glance your comment seems reasonable, but is it really a problem? Why not just grep for the function name? Blindly grepping for the complete log string is already going to fail for those log messages that contain C string format specifiers.

Using `__func__` is preferred because it means one less thing that can be forgotten to be updated when moving the code around to another function.\nThis guarantees that the message will actually have been emitted in the function that is mentioned in the message.\nAs for grepping the message, you could search either the function itself, then locate it manually, or for part of the message that fol
